response.answer_text: “Cavemen” is not a scientific or anthropological term, and might be used to describe any of several human ancestor species. Our own ancestors, Homo Sapiens, were around for 300,000 years at least and while they might have camped in a cave occasionally, they were primarily hunter-gatherers. They were fully language capable. As for Neanderthal, they may have had a well developed language. likewise the immediate ancestor of Sapiens, Homo Heidelbergensis.
How did cavemen communicate? That article answers your query. Hope you find it helpful.
